workflow.name: Automate follower resource distribution on BlueSky with keyword-triggered DMs
workflow.description:
This workflow acts as an automated engagement bot. It sends a Direct Message (DM) with a link or resource to any follower who replies to your post with a specific target keyword.

## Who is this for
Ideal for creators and community managers who want to distribute resources (PDFs, links, invites) to their audience automatically without manually messaging each person.

## What it does
It scans your notifications for new replies and applies a strict filter to ensure only the right people get messaged:
* **Targeted:** It only monitors replies on the specific post you choose.
* **Keyword Match:** Checks if the user's reply contains your specific trigger word (e.g., "Send").
* **Follower Check:** Verifies if the user is following you (if not, it skips them).
* **Delivery:** Opens a chat conversation and sends your pre-set message.
* **Engagement:** Automatically "Likes" the user's reply to confirm receipt.
* **Anti-Spam:** Remembers processed replies so it never messages the same user twice for the same interaction.

## How to set up
1. **Configuration:** Open the first node ("Configuration") and enter:
   * **BlueSky Credentials:** Your Handle and App Password.
   * **Target Post URL:** The full link to the specific BlueSky post you want to monitor.
   * **Trigger Keyword:** The word users must type (e.g., "Template").
   * **DM Message:** The actual text/link to send them.
2. **Activate:** Turn the workflow on. It runs every 30 minutes to batch-process new replies.

## üöÄ The BlueSky Growth Suite
This workflow is part of a 3-part automation suite designed to help you grow on BlueSky:
* **Part 1: Post Scheduler** (Manage content from Google Sheets)
* **Part 2: Analytics Tracker** (Track likes/reposts back to Sheets)
* **Part 3: Auto-DM Bot** (This template)

workflow.name: BlueSky Suite: Auto-DM followers who reply with a keyword

parameters.content:
### 1- START HERE 
Enter your 
- BlueSky Handle (e.g., steve.bsky.social)
- App Password. 
This sets up the authentication for the whole workflow.
- Trigger Keyword: The word users must type (e.g., Linkedin).
- DM text: Message to send followers when they reply with the "Trigger Keyword"

### 2- Get access token
Login to BlueSky using handle and app password to get the access token. This will be used in all future BlueSky api calls.

### 3- Google sheets rows 
Fetcher Grabs all rows where Status column is "Posted". 

If you want to test, manually add a row with "Post" in your sheet first.

# üöÄ Lead Magnet / Auto-DM Bot - How To Use

**Goal:** Automatically DM a link/resource to anyone who replies to your posts with a specific keyword (e.g., "LinkedIn").

**Step 1:** Campaign Setup Open the "Configuration" node (first green node) and set:

- Handle & Password: Your BlueSky credentials.
- Trigger Keyword: The word users must type (e.g., Template).
- DM Message: The message they will receive (e.g., "Hey! Here is the link: ...").


**Step 2:** The "Growth Hack" Logic This workflow checks 3 things before sending a message:

- Did they use the Keyword?
- Is this a New reply? (Prevents duplicate DMs).
- Do they Follow you? (Incentivizes followers).


**Step 3:** Activate Turn it to "Active". It runs every 15 minutes, scanning your notifications for new leads.

[**Sample Google Sheet**](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Mg04gK1K5DBtJHrWw3ePRFc_JjkxwAp0deGjapVl2q0/edit?usp=sharing)



## ‚ö†Ô∏è READ BEFORE TESTING

**In Manual Testing Mode:**
n8n wipes the memory (`staticData`) every time you click "Execute". The bot will **forget** previous runs and may send duplicate DMs to the same user during manual tests.

**To Test Deduplication Properly:**
1. **Activate** the workflow (Toggle "Active" in top right).
2. Reply to your post on BlueSky using the keyword.
3. Wait for the workflow to run automatically (every 15 min).
4. Check "Executions" to confirm it only processed the reply **once**.

### 5- The Keyword Filter 
Filters the stream to only allow:
- Replies (ignores likes/reposts).
- Text that contains your Trigger keyword (from the Config node).

### 6- The Memory Gatekeeper 
**‚ö†Ô∏è System Node: Handles deduplication. No configuration needed here.**

This script remembers the timestamp of the last processed reply. It ensures that even if the workflow runs 100 times, it never sends a duplicate DM to the same user for the same reply.

### 4- The Unpacker 
The BlueSky API sends us one big list containing 25 notifications. This node "explodes" that list into 25 separate items so we can filter and process each notification individually.

### 8- The Growth Hook 
We check if the user follows you.

If YES: They get the DM.

If NO: We skip them. (This encourages users to follow you to get the resource).

### 12- Like the reply
The "Delight" Factor Before finishing, we "Like" the user's reply. 

This gives them a notification "Creator liked your reply", confirming you saw them, even if the DM takes a moment to arrive.

### 7- The Processor 
Takes the "Winning Replies" (those that passed the keyword and duplicate checks) and handles them one by one. 

This ensures that the variables for User A don't get mixed up with User B.

### 9- The Growth Gate 
This checks the data from the previous node ("Check Follow Status").

True Path: The user follows you ‚Üí Send them the DM.

False Path: They don't follow ‚Üí Stop. (This effectively "locks" your lead magnet behind a follow).

### 10- The Handshake 
You cannot send a DM directly to a User ID. 

You must first ask the Chat API to find (or create) a Conversation ID between you and that user. 

This node performs that "handshake."

### 11- The Delivery 
Uses the Conversation ID we just retrieved to send the actual text message. 

**Note:** The message text is pulled dynamically from your Configuration node at the start.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
